messages: 96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:32): hmm, finding the SVG definition for <style> is tricky
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:32): well, one that matches the current intent of the WG
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:37): <svg contentStyleType> seems to only affect style= attributes
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:47): at least Opera and Safari ignore contentStyleType
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:49): Does that mean I can be in a <style> too? Yay!
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:52): not sure what you mean
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:54): well, if <style> doesn't have it's contentType checked, then I'm a valid contentType!
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:55): I believe for <style> browsers do adhere to it
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:55): well, some set of browsers, Opera doesn't
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:55): I really don't like that this is based on MIME types which can have parameters and all
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:55): it should just be a set of known values, checked against in a case-insensitive way
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:55): human a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 is valid?
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:56): human is not a valid primary type (or whatever it's called)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:57): wonders if he can be an application (that follows the human spec)
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:57): application/annevk+human
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (19:58): contrary to +xml, here it might actually be useful...
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:58): not application/annevk+robot then? :P
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:04): what is a decent text editor for the Mac?
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:04): TextEdit sucks rocks
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:04): I use SubEthaEdit and nano myself
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:06): hmm, nano looks rather ancient
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:06): :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:06): I've always preferred simplicity within CLIs
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:07): command line interface
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:07): just thought of that
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:07): the other one works, so far
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:08): can i somewhere say that it should never ever hide extensions?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:09): Finder prefs, off the top of my head
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:09): thanks
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:09): tried finding it where Windows hides it
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:10): and while you're here, how do I switch between app windows again?
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:10): (one app, multiple windows)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:12): in what? Expos?©? or without?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:13): without I don't think there is a consistent way, with is F10 by default (see sys-prefs -> expos?©)
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:13): without expose
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:13): like cmd+tab
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:14): what cmd+tab does for apps*
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:14): doesn't think there is a consistent one

96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:24): I think for <svg:style type> the browser should do case-insensitive match for text/css and that's it, no special treatment for whitespace, parameters, they all result in not applying the style sheet
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:24): i think we can do the same for HTML
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:26): hmm, <svg:style type=""> get applied in WebKit, I guess that's ok
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:42): <svg:script> is more annoying
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:43): way more values, text/ecmascript, text/javascript, text/javascript1.0, etc.
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:43): also, parameters probably need to be processed in some way
96626168c6097aefced1ab85fd80fd6b (20:49): seems that we process type= in some way
